intro: Cyrtandra thamnodes, commonly known as the Hawaiian waterplant or Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Cyrtandra thamnodes is often found in wetlands and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the region's biodiversity.
